Crime_Name: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act Violation
Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA officer's decision was reasonable regarding the applicant's sexual orientation and perceived Jewish identity
Application_Facts: Applicant provided detailed affidavit evidence regarding sexual orientation; officer ignored risks related to perceived Jewish identity; no credible reason given to doubt testimony
Decision_Outcome: PRRA and H&C decisions were found unreasonable
Court_Ruling: Judicial review granted; matters remitted for re-determination before a different officer
Defendant_Behavior: PRRA officer demanded undue corroboration and made veiled credibility findings without justification
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonableness, procedural fairness breaches, failure to properly assess evidence
Legal_Standard: PRRA officers must consider evidence reasonably without requiring undue corroboration or making impermissible credibility assessments
Assessment_Factor: Global assessment of hardship in H&C decisions
Procedural_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness in evaluation of evidence
Credibility_Assessment: Officer improperly questioned credibility without basis; no veiled credibility findings permitted
Evidence_Used: Affidavit evidence on sexual orientation, country condition information on treatment of Jewish individuals
Legal_Provision_Cited: Sections of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act relating to PRRA and H&C considerations
Application_Basis: Persecution risk based on sexual orientation and perceived religious identity
Evidence_Assessed: Affidavit evidence on sexual orientation, background risk information on Jewish identity
Relief_Sought: Re-determination of PRRA and H&C applications
Governing_Rule: PRRA officers must not require undue corroboration and must conduct a fair, comprehensive assessment
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Demand for corroboration despite sufficient affidavit evidence
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution due to sexual orientation and perceived Jewish identity if returned
Cause_Description: Applicant challenged negative PRRA and H&C decisions due to errors in evidence evaluation and lack of procedural fairness
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly consider submitted evidence; inappropriate demand for corroboration
Legal_Provision_Violated: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act provisions on fair PRRA and H&C assessment
Evidence_Issues: Insistence on corroboration, disregard of relevant identity-based risks
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and unreasonable assessment of applicant's evidence
Decision_Rationale: Officer erred by demanding unnecessary corroboration and ignoring key risk factors
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of proper evidentiary foundation for discrediting applicant's claims
